bibl.title: Letter from A.M. Stimson to H. McG. Robertson, January 8, 1924

div1.p: Stimson sends Robertson a rat flea survey done by Fox.

div1.head: Letter from A.M. Stimson to H. McG. Robertson, January 8, 1924
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 8, 1924.
Surgeon H. McG. Robertson,
U. S. Public Health Service,
1110 Capitol Street,
Richmond, Virginia.
My dear Dr. Robertson:
div1.p:
I refer to the request in your letter of December 14
for information as to the rat flea survey, and to my reply of
December 27.

I take pleasure in forwarding herewith a copy of Dr.
Fox's report for this work up to December 31, 1923. With refer-
ence to the last sentence in this report, 135 Kenopsylla cheopis
from Galveston were reported as examined in the November report.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, (A. M. Stimson)
Assistant Surgeon General. AEB.
Incl.
